data.title: First post and why i made this blog
data.description: If you want to know why i made this blog this is a good place to start.
data.lead: In this post i will not try to convince you why you should read this blog - for this are marketers. What i will try is to tell you about polish homemade alcohols and what i will try to post and what not.

content.html:
Most of people when hear about something they have already some picture of what to expect when you have to read about homemade alcohols. Poland is in central Europe close to Russia so we probably do moonshine. Yes we brew moonshine to some degree, but we also makes a lot of other things most of people never heard off.

One of examples are tinctures. There are 2 types of them: medicinal and flavored. To be honest i am not fan of medicial ones. Most of them just not taste good. Are they healthy? I don't know. Market of pseudo healthy products which gives you better immunity against disease or enchance organ functions is worth bilions, but it often comes from unqualified persons and yes they help, but in most cases you can skip using them and don't feel any diffrence. Maybe in future i will post some article about making one, but i want to focus on flavored ones, because they are ones you get when you come to some regional harvest festival. In most cases what you will get is tincture from cherry, plums, bird cherry, quince, walnut, strawberry, black lilac and more. Most of them is made from fruits typical for region. On example you will not see so often sea buckthorn tincture in center of poland.

This type of regional alcohols gonna be main focus of blog. I also plan to show you some wines made of regional fruits and if some popular wines like cherry wine is made different i will also try to cover it.

previous.title: Sea ​​buckthorn tincture
previous.description: Sea ​​buckthorn tincture is one of the best alcohols i made and taste. After filtration tastes like fresh apricot but after 6 months tincture start to show hidden honey flavors.
previous.lead: It's one of my best drinks i made 2 years ago. At first i wasn't convince, because many people on youtube said this tincture is one of "healing" ones and when someone describe tincture this way it mostly means she taste bad but i was so wrong about this one.

content.html:
Picking fruits

Sea buckthorn fruits are one one of the most annoying fruits to pick. The main reason is a structure of fruit. Berry of sea buckthorn is almost completly fill with juice, so every atempt can end with squizing the juice and waste it in result. At the top of that every little branch has thorns so picking it without plan is a good way to waste a day and pick only half of what you tried to get.

Luckly people found better way to pick sea buckthorn. You pick small branches with fruits and freeze them for few hours until they are are rock solid. Normaly you would also want to freeze fruits before puting them into jar because fruits need to be frozen anyway. This way fruits loose strange taste and become lightly sour and sweet. So every time i go to pick some sea buckthorn i take scisors and garden shears. I cut mostly good branches. Good branches should look like those on the picture.

Preparing fruits to next stage

Then i cut branches into pieces so more can fit into freezer. After few hours or next day they are ready to tear apart. Even then it is not so easy and i need to pay attention to thorns and if they are still solid.

Final Stage

You can make as much as you want but proportions are always the same

On every 0.5 kg of sea buckthorn you need:

0.5 kg of sugar

750 ml 50% alcohol.

I use 90% alcohol and dilute it half to half with water.

Put fruits and sugar in the jar and pour alcohol. Mix it up and put a jar in some dark place. Wait 5 weeks and remember to shake it atleast once per week. Chance to get mold is rather low but not low enough to put away and forget about it.

This is how it looks after 3 weeks of maceration. Notice how much dust is flowing inside container.

After 5 weeks remove the fruits with strainer and filter it. I filter it in few stages. Pour the liquid over paper towel. Second is coffee filter. Just take a funnel, put a filration material inside and pour liquid.

After filtration, tincture should mature for 6 months. During this time it will darken and get new flavors. At the end it should have dark amber color.
content.markdown:
### Picking fruits

Sea buckthorn fruits are one one of the most annoying fruits to pick. The main reason is a structure of fruit. Berry of sea buckthorn is almost completly fill with juice, so every atempt can end with squizing the juice and waste it in result. At the top of that every little branch has thorns so picking it without plan is a good way to waste a day and pick only half of what you tried to get.

Luckly people found better way to pick sea buckthorn. You pick small branches with fruits and freeze them for few hours until they are are rock solid. Normaly you would also want to freeze fruits before puting them into jar because fruits need to be frozen anyway. This way fruits loose strange taste and become lightly sour and sweet. So every time i go to pick some sea buckthorn i take scisors and garden shears. I cut mostly good branches. Good branches should look like those on the picture.

![1_max.jpg](https://media.graphassets.com/MVT5KsKgSQybgEmBivaZ "1_max.jpg")![313939396_676838410419829_3264835348585635456_n.jpg](https://media.graphassets.com/cjPKJdzdReWk6nBqDpB6 "313939396_676838410419829_3264835348585635456_n.jpg")

### Preparing fruits to next stage

Then i cut branches into pieces so more can fit into freezer. After few hours or next day they are ready to tear apart. Even then it is not so easy and i need to pay attention to thorns and if they are still solid.

![313901445_835251997709594_2700205694418044629_n.jpg](https://media.graphassets.com/SbGKuZyuTXeYii3HR0GY "313901445_835251997709594_2700205694418044629_n.jpg")

### Final Stage

You can make as much as you want but proportions are always the same

**On every 0.5 kg of sea buckthorn** you need:

0.5 kg of sugar

750 ml 50% alcohol.

I use 90% alcohol and dilute it half to half with water.

Put fruits and sugar in the jar and pour alcohol. Mix it up and put a jar in some dark place. Wait 5 weeks and remember to shake it atleast once per week. Chance to get mold is rather low but not low enough to put away and forget about it.

This is how it looks after 3 weeks of maceration. Notice how much dust is flowing inside container.

![IMG_20221103_102457.jpg](https://media.graphassets.com/output=format:webp/resize=width:2336,height:4160/LdIfjkj3QBvZg2UqrRE3 "IMG_20221103_102457.jpg")

After 5 weeks remove the fruits with strainer and filter it. I filter it in few stages. Pour the liquid over paper towel. Second is coffee filter. Just take a funnel, put a filration material inside and pour liquid.

After filtration, tincture should mature for 6 months. During this time it will darken and get new flavors. At the end it should have dark amber color.
